text.tspan: Edun is a fashion brand based in New York,
who collaborate with artisans across the African
continent to produce sustainable, high quality
garments. Adriaan Louw directed this mini-
documentary, focussing on the brand outlook
and the relationships between them and their
partners in Nairobi, Kenya. Adriaan did a great
job of recording a hand loom, operated by one
of the films subjects, which was used as the
starting point of the score’s tempo and steady,
hypnotic atmosphere. Many cues were also
taken from traditional Masaai music and chants.
Nic van Reenen spent most of his
musical noise of all varieties and
s grown to become rather capable
of restraining and coaxing the chaotic
Nic has a varied and eclectic creative
Edun is a fashion brand based in New York,
who collaborate with artisans across the African
continent to produce sustainable, high quality
garments. Adriaan Louw directed this mini-
documentary, focussing on the brand outlook
and the relationships between them and their
partners in Nairobi, Kenya. Adriaan did a great
job of recording a hand loom, operated by one
of the films subjects, which was used as the
starting point of the score’s tempo and steady,
hypnotic atmosphere. Many cues were also
taken from traditional Masaai music and chants.
Edun is a fashion brand based in New York,
who collaborate with artisans across the African
continent to produce sustainable, high quality
garments. Adriaan Louw directed this mini-
documentary, focussing on the brand outlook
and the relationships between them and their
partners in Nairobi, Kenya. Adriaan did a great
job of recording a hand loom, operated by one
of the films subjects, which was used as the
starting point of the score’s tempo and steady,
hypnotic atmosphere. Many cues were also
taken from traditional Masaai music and chants.

the chaotic noise into compelling and
Nic has a varied and eclectic creative
Edun is a fashion brand based in New York,
who collaborate with artisans across the African
continent to produce sustainable, high quality
garments. Adriaan Louw directed this mini-
documentary, focussing on the brand outlook
and the relationships between them and their
partners in Nairobi, Kenya. Adriaan did a great
job of recording a hand loom, operated by one
of the films subjects, which was used as the
starting point of the score’s tempo and steady,
hypnotic atmosphere. Many cues were also
taken from traditional Masaai music and chants.
Winner: Berlin International Fashion Film Festival (2013)
Nic van Reenen spent most of his
musical noise of all varieties and timbres
to become rather capable of restraining
and coaxing the chaotic noise into
Nic has a varied and eclectic creative
